trustfund:
TF054881-West African Economic and
            Monetary Union Capital Market Development Pro,TF055074-WAEMU CAPITAL MARKETS
            DEVELOPMENT (CHILD UNDER TF055073)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the West Africa Economic and
            Monetary Union (WAEMU) Capital Market Development Project
            for Africa were as follows: overall outcome was moderately
            unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate;
            bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory; borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. The principal
            objective of the project was to develop the capital markets
            in the WAEMU region, and mobilize public and private
            financing for the region infrastructure development. The
            project is expected to contribute to the WAEMU countries
            efforts to achieve sustainable regional economic growth
            through the provision of efficient, region wide
            infrastructure services and greater financial market
            integration. There were some important project lessons
            learned: (i) well-identified pipeline of projects and
            actions is critical for effectively establishing a guarantee
            facility; (ii) guarantee facilities require the
            identification of strong and capacitated intermediaries
            prior to the commencement of operations; (iii) effectiveness
            conditions should be realistic; (iv) multi-donor operations
            require clear and efficient implementation arrangements; (v)
            the implementation of project activities co-financed by
            different donors created practical; and (vi) project
            supervision requires close oversight, and active
            decision-making from management in light of early warning signs.
